intro: Cliffortia eriocephalina, commonly known as the woolly flaxlily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is often found in mountainous regions and is well-suited to coastal climates. Cliffortia eriocephalina is valued for its ornamental appeal and is commonly cultivated in gardens.
